fields.description:
I try to open a webview setting html in the webview.html property.

Results:
[Appcelerator Studio]
Empty screen with correct height size.
I have tried android:hardwareAccelerated both true and false (in the Samsung Young 2 the trace is the same)

[Play Store]
It works.
fields.summary: [Android] Local html not rendered in webview
fields.environment:
Windows 10 Pro 64bits
Appcelerator Studio build 4.8.1.201612050850
Node.js 4.2.2
npm Version 2.14.7
Appcelerator CLI
    installer: 4.2.9
    Core package: 6.2.0
Titanium CLI
    CLI version: 5.0.12
    node apc version: 0.2.41
Titanium sdk: 6.0.3GA (also with 5.5.1GA)
Java 1.7.0_80
Android sdk tools 25.2.5
Android sdk platform-tools 25.0.4

Testing Devices:
    Huawei P8-Lite (model ALE-L21) with EMUI 4.0 (android 6.0)
    Samsung Galaxy Young 2 (model SM-G130HN) (android 4.4.2)

comments.body: Hello, Please share a sample code. Thanks.

Because it is possible that the error depends on the performance of the device, I have prepared a sample text with 20 paragraphs, and each time the window is opened it shows a random number of them (by default the maximum is 5).
Opening and closing the screen, it is possible to find the error quickly.

For example, a Huawei P8 Lite can show the webview loaded with 2 paragraphs but not with 3.
